summary: The state of Texas is divided into 254 counties.
full_text: Cochran County is a county located in the U.S. state of Texas. As of the 2010 census, its population was 3,127. The county seat is Morton. The county was created in 1876 and later organized in 1924. It is named for Robert E. Cochran, a defender of the Alamo.
title: Cochran County, Texas
